activities: Employee Personal Information is transferred from the EU to the U.S. for Lectra employees. This includes information available in employee’s personal profile (e.g., home address and phone number, work and compensation history, planned salary, earnings, career development, paid time off, language preferences, education, emergency contacts, gender); it also includes some sensitive personal information (e.g., race, ethnicity, health information). Among the reasons Lectra collects, stores and processes personal information are: employee management and administration (including both during and after employment), employment verification, administering employee benefits, administering personal short or long term compensation programs or benefits, evaluating performance, managing corporate programs, conducting disciplinary proceedings, processing health insurance claims, and maintaining and monitoring usage of internal networks and IT systems. Lectra also contracts with third party providers to render related services, including payroll processors, call centers and support services.
